meanings.definition: The quality or state of being strong and sturdy.
meanings.sent1: The ruggedness of the mountain made it difficult to climb.
meanings.sent2: Hiking boots are designed for ruggedness to endure tough terrains.
meanings.sent3: The old, rugged boots had seen better days but still held up.
meanings.sent4: Her determination showed a ruggedness that inspired others.
meanings.sent5: The ruggedness of the tree roots intertwined like a fortress underground.

meanings.definition: The rough and uneven nature of a surface.
meanings.sent1: The ruggedness of the road caused the car to bounce.
meanings.sent2: The ruggedness of the rocks made walking along the beach challenging.
meanings.sent3: The ruggedness of the carpet made it hard to vacuum.
meanings.sent4: The ruggedness of the terrain made it perfect for off-road biking.
meanings.sent5: The ruggedness of the bark scraped against his hand as he climbed the tree.

meanings.definition: The ability to withstand harsh conditions or rough treatment.
meanings.sent1: His ruggedness in the face of adversity was admirable.
meanings.sent2: The tent's ruggedness kept the campers dry during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The ruggedness of the phone case protected it from damage when dropped.
meanings.sent4: Her ruggedness in handling criticism showed her strength of character.
meanings.sent5: The ruggedness of the ship allowed it to sail through the stormy seas.
